Pre-Game Insights: Hungary will be aiming to make amends for a heavy loss to Germany when they take on Bosnia in their second group game.
Even though there are no fresh injury worries in the home team, SK Rapid defender Bendeguz Bolla should be recalled to the starting XI.
Bosnia, on the other hand, are on a seven-game losing run in all competitions and given their poor defensive display in a 5-2 loss to Netherlands, home win should definitely be considered.
Fenerbahce attacker Edin Dzeko will lead the line for the visitors, while Crvena Zvezda summer signing Rade Krunic should be recalled to the starting XI.
Bosnia boss Sergej Barbarez should stick to the 4-3-3 formation.
